CHAT.comment: Home Visit 7; Chi sits at head of dining room table with Mot perpendicular to her

MOT suggests reading the book aloud so they can remember what it's about. Mot stays silent during Chi's reading , which includes comments of a nonimmediate nature. As soon as Chi finishes reading , MOT jumps in to say <now you have to write a letter>. Chi wants to write a draft on different paper , but EXP discourages it. Mot discourages Chi from erasing each mistake , because it takes a lot of time , and context notes say Mot is very tired. Chi needs a fair amount of support in punctuation and spelling , considering how old she is. Mot provides support , but most of the ideas are Chi's. EXP pipes in too , but not a lot. Mot misspells fantastic and written. Chi asks how Eric Carle can answer her questions. EXP says they'll put a return address on the letter.

u.a: covers her eyes as if trying to guess what items are
bulges out eyes at pause , meaning huge
Chi erases comma after <Dear> and puts one after <Eric>
MOT points to place on page where Chi should write
doesn't want Chi to erase mistake
maybe Mot is thinking of the words <very good> and Chi is thinking of penmanship
opens book to cover page to see illustrations
Chi probably asked for help by whispering
Chi's uncle comes into the house , says hello , and disappears discreetly
Chi has to scrunch letters together to put full name on line
